title: Instructional Design Theory Understanding Process Using Collaborative Autoethnography

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics teaching experience or introductory educational theory knowledge
context.additional_context: Course exploring methods for pre-service/in-service teachers to apply mathematics instructional design theories to actual classes, emphasizing collaborative reflection and sharing personal experiences in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can deconstruct core concepts of instructional design theories and reinterpret them in the context of everyday language/mathematics instruction.
Learners can analyze peers' teaching experiences through collaborative autoethnography activities and derive connections between theory and practice.
Learners can identify theoretical conflict cases in mathematics instruction and propose alternative instructional design approaches.

resources: Digital Collaboration Tools (e.g., Google Workspace), Theoretical Case Database, Reflective Journal Template

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
